lines.content: The time is saved a lot as no need hardcoding everything js need to tell want to do and in which way
The time is saved at least 1.5h with helping of AI
But the problem is for like tests and error handing you need to do it yourself to get everything tested  and every case considered
When encountering some cases the AI can not help debugging for text errors and some small error ike space can not be detected, you need to find out yourself and you
may need think on your own in string finding need include space or not. With AI it  is a more design work not duplicate working.

Sometimes may need more precise command to make the AI work ideally. Moreover, the changing of OOP for example need more human practice as the AI often miss one or two parts of the code when rewriting.
This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Crisp_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/crisp.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run crisp.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
What can I do for you?

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
toolVersion = '11.0.0'  // Or whichever version you need
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-base', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-controls', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-fxml', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'win'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'mac'
implementation group: 'org.openjfx', name: 'javafx-graphics', version: javaFxVersion, classifier: 'linux'

Crisp is a **task management chatbot** that helps you organize your todos, deadlines, and events through a conversational interface. You can add, delete, mark/unmark, snooze, and search for tasks quickly using simple text commands. The application also features a user-friendly, asymmetric chat GUI with clear error highlighting.
Use the `deadline` command to add a task that must be completed by a specific date or time.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Use the `todo` command to add a task without a deadline.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Use the `event` command to add a task that occurs within a specific time range.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 5 tasks in the list.
Use the `list` command to display all tasks in your list.
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Use the `delete` command to remove a task from your list.
Now you have 4 tasks in the list.
Postpone a taskâ€™s deadline or event by a number of days.
Got it. I've postponed the task by 3 days.
Find tasks by keywords using the `search` command.
Use the `show` command to display all tasks scheduled for a particular date. This is useful for quickly checking what you have planned on a given day.
- Only tasks whose **deadline (`/by`)** or **event date (`/from` or `/to`)** matches the specified date are shown.
- If no tasks exist on that date, the app displays:
Use the `bye` command to close Crisp safely.
Use the `bye` command to close Crisp safely.
Bye! Hope to see you again soon!
- User messages appear on one side (greenish bubble).
- Bot messages appear on the opposite side (white bubble).
- Invalid commands or input are displayed in **red error bubbles**.
- Optional circular avatars with drop shadows for clarity.
- Chat window and content resize gracefully.
- Subtle backgrounds, rounded corners, readable fonts, and padding improve user experience.
Oops! You need to provide a description for your todo. Example: todo read book
- For date input, follow the format: `yyyy-MM-dd`.
* The {@code Crisp} class represents the main application for the Crisp task manager.
* It handles initialization of storage, tasks, and user interface, and provides
* a method to process user input and return responses.
* Attempts to load tasks from storage; if loading fails, initializes an empty task list.
ui.showError("Failed to load tasks. Starting with empty list.");
* Processes a single user input command.
* Parses the input, executes the corresponding command, and returns the message
* generated by the command. If an error occurs, returns an error message instead.
* @param input the user input command string
* @return the response message to be displayed to the user
return ("OOPS!!! Please provide a valid task number.");
return ("OOPS!!! The task number you entered does not exist.");
* @return the welcome message to be displayed to the user
* Represents a generic command in the Crisp application.
* All specific commands (e.g., AddCommand, DeleteCommand) extend this class.
* Each command can be executed on a TaskList with a Ui and Storage.
* @param tasks   the TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui      the Ui for printing messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting changes
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Returns whether this command exits the application.
* By default, commands do not exit, so this returns false.
* @return true if this command exits the application, false otherwise
/** Returns the message to display after executing the command */
* Represents a command to add a deadline task to the TaskList.
* When executed, a new Deadline task is created from the given description and due date,
* added to the TaskList, a confirmation message is shown to the user via the Ui,
* and the updated list is saved to storage.
* Constructs a DeadlineCommand with the given description and due date.
* @param description the description of the deadline task
* @param by          the due date of the task in "yyyy-MM-dd" format
* Creates a new Deadline task, adds it to the TaskList,
* shows a confirmation message via Ui, and saves the updated TaskList.
* @param tasks   the TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui      the Ui for printing messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting tasks
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
// Preconditions: none of these should be null
assert tasks != null : "TaskList must not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui must not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage must not be null";

// Postcondition: size should increase by exactly 1
assert tasks.size() == oldSize + 1 : "TaskList size should increase by 1 after adding task";
// Postcondition: message should not be null or empty

* When executed, it updates the task's status, displays a message via Ui,
* and saves the updated TaskList to Storage.

* Represents a command that searches for tasks containing specified keywords.
* Supports searching with multiple keywords. The search is case-insensitive.

throw new IllegalArgumentException("You must provide at least one keyword.");
* Executes the search command, printing all tasks that match any of the keywords.
* The search is case-insensitive. Tasks are printed with numbering in the order
* they appear in the TaskList. If no tasks match, a message is printed.
* @param tasks the TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui the Ui object for printing messages
* @param storage the Storage object (not used in this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList must not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui must not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage must not be null";

+ (matchedTasks.isEmpty() ? " No tasks match your search." : matchedTasks);
assert message != null && !message.isEmpty() : "SearchCommand should always produce a non-empty message";

* Represents a command to display all tasks occurring on a specific date.
* The date is provided as a string in the format "yyyy-MM-dd".
* When executed, this command lists all Deadline and Event tasks

* If the date format is invalid, an error message is displayed via Ui.

* If no tasks are found, a message indicating this is printed.
* If the date string is invalid, an error message is displayed via Ui.
* @param tasks   the TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui      the Ui for printing error messages
* @param storage the Storage (unused in this command)
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
assert tasks != null : "TaskList must not be null";
assert ui != null : "Ui must not be null";
assert storage != null : "Storage must not be null";

* Indicates that this command does not exit the application.
* Represents a command to snooze (postpone) a task in the TaskList.
* This command supports {@link Deadline} and {@link Event} tasks.
* When executed, it postpones the task's date(s) by a specified number of days.
* The updated task is saved to storage, and a confirmation message is generated.
*     SnoozeCommand cmd = new SnoozeCommand(2, 3); // snooze task at index 2 by 3 days
/** The index of the task to snooze (0-based). */
/** The number of days to postpone the task. */
/** Message describing the result of executing this command. */
* Constructs a SnoozeCommand for a given task index and number of days.
* @param index the index of the task in the TaskList (0-based)
* @param days  the number of days to postpone the task
* If the task is a {@link Deadline}, its due date is postponed.
* If the task is an {@link Event}, both the start and end dates are postponed.
* Updates the {@link Storage} and generates a confirmation message.
* If the task is not a Deadline or Event, a message indicates it cannot be snoozed.
* @param tasks   the TaskList containing all tasks
* @param ui      the Ui for printing messages
* @param storage the Storage for persisting changes
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
Task task = tasks.get(index); // assume valid index
assert task != null : "Task should not be null";
message = "Cannot snooze this type of task.";
message = "Task has been snoozed by " + days + " day(s): " + task;

* @param ui      the Ui for displaying confirmation messages
* @param storage the Storage used to save the updated task list
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Represents a dialog box consisting of an {@link ImageView} to represent the speaker's face
* and a {@link Label} containing text from the speaker.
* This class can create two types of dialog boxes:

*
  • User dialog box (image on the right, text on the left)

*
  • Crisp dialog box (image on the left, text on the right)
* The appearance of the dialog can be customized via CSS and FXML.
* Constructs a {@code DialogBox} with the given text and image.
* Loads the FXML layout, sets the controller, and initializes the dialog text and image.
* @param text the text message to display
* Flips the dialog box so that the image is displayed on the left and the text on the right.
* This is used for Crisp's messages to differentiate them from user messages.
* Creates a dialog box for the user message.
* The image will appear on the right side of the box.
* @param text the text message from the user
* @return a {@code DialogBox} representing the user's message
public static DialogBox getUserDialog(String text, Image img) {
* Creates a dialog box for Crisp's message.
* The image will appear on the left side of the box.
* @param text the text message from Crisp
public static DialogBox getCrispDialog(String text, Image img) {
* The {@code Launcher} class serves as the entry point for the Crisp JavaFX application.
* This class exists as a workaround for certain classpath issues when launching JavaFX applications
* from some IDEs or build tools.
* It simply delegates to {@link Main}, which is the actual JavaFX application class.
* The entry point of the Crisp JavaFX application.
* This method launches the JavaFX runtime and starts the application.
* @param args the command-line arguments passed to the application
* The {@code Main} class is the JavaFX application entry point for the Crisp GUI.
* It loads the {@link MainWindow} FXML layout, injects a {@link Crisp} instance into
* the controller, and displays the main application window.
* Loads the FXML layout, sets the scene on the stage, injects the Crisp instance
* into the controller, and displays the stage.
* @param stage the primary stage provided by JavaFX
// Inject the Crisp instance into the controller
* Controller for the main GUI window of the Crisp application.
* Handles user input, displays dialog boxes for both the user and Crisp,
* and initializes the scrollable dialog container.
/** ScrollPane containing the dialog container, scrolls automatically. */
/** VBox that holds all dialog boxes in the conversation. */
/** TextField where the user types input commands. */
/** Button for sending user input (optional, can trigger same as Enter key). */
/** The Crisp instance handling command execution and responses. */
/** Image representing the user avatar in dialog boxes. */
/** Image representing Crisp's avatar in dialog boxes. */
* Binds the vertical scroll value of the ScrollPane to the height of the dialog container,
* so the view automatically scrolls down as new messages are added.
* Injects the {@link Crisp} instance into this controller.
* Also displays the initial greeting message from Crisp in the dialog container.
* @param c the Crisp instance to handle commands and responses
* Displays the initial greeting message from Crisp in a dialog box.
* Handles user input when Enter is pressed (or send button is clicked).
* Appends them to the dialog container and clears the input field afterwards.
// Get the stage from any node in the scene, e.g., userInput
// Optional: delay a little so the user sees the goodbye message
* Represents a task with a specific deadline date.
* A Deadline task has a description, a due date, and a status indicating
* whether it is done or not.
/** Input date format used to parse date strings. */
/** Output date format used for displaying the deadline. */
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
/** The due date of the deadline task. */
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param byStr       the due date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the date string is invalid
public Deadline(String description, String byStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description, due date, and status.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param byStr       the due date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @param status      the status of the task
* @throws DateTimeParseException if the date string is invalid
public Deadline(String description, String byStr, Status status) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Returns a string representation of the task suitable for saving to a file.
* Returns the description of the task.
* Postpones the deadline by the specified number of days.
* The {@code by} date is shifted forward by the given number of days.
* @param days the number of days to postpone; must be positive
* @throws AssertionError if {@code days} is not positive
assert days > 0 : "Days to postpone must be positive";
* Returns the due date of the task.
* Returns a human-readable string representation of the task.
* Represents a task that occurs over a specific date range.
* An Event task has a description, a start date, an end date, and a status
* indicating whether it is done or not.
/** Input date format used to parse date strings. */
/** Output date format used for displaying the event dates. */
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
/** The start date of the event. */
/** The end date of the event. */
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param fromStr     the start date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @param toStr       the end date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @throws DateTimeParseException if either date string is invalid
public Event(String description, String fromStr, String toStr) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start date, end date, and status.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param fromStr     the start date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @param toStr       the end date in yyyy-MM-dd format
* @param status      the status of the task
* @throws DateTimeParseException if either date string is invalid
public Event(String description, String fromStr, String toStr, Status status) throws DateTimeParseException {
* Returns the start date of the event.
* Returns the end date of the event.
* Returns the description of the event.
* Returns a human-readable string representation of the event task.
* Returns a string representation of the task suitable for saving to a file.
* Postpones the event by the specified number of days.
* Both the start ({@code from}) and end ({@code to}) dates
* of the event are shifted forward by the given number of days.
* @param days the number of days to postpone the event; must be positive
* @throws AssertionError if {@code days} is not positive
assert days > 0 : "Days to postpone must be positive";
* Represents the completion status of a task.
* A task can either be NOT_DONE or DONE. Each status has an associated
* icon for display purposes: a space " " for NOT_DONE and "X" for DONE.
/** Task has not been completed yet. */
/** The icon representing this status in task display. */
* Constructs a Status enum with the specified icon.
* @param icon the string symbol representing this status
* Returns the icon associated with this status.
* Represents a generic task with a description, type, and status.
* This is an abstract base class for specific types of tasks such as
* {@link Deadline}, {@link Event}, and {@link Todo}. Each task has:
/** The current completion status of the task. */
/** The type of the task (TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT). */
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description and type.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param type the type of the task
* Constructs a new Task with the specified description, type, and status.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param type the type of the task
* @param status the initial completion status of the task
public Task(String description, TaskType type, Status status) {
* Marks the task as not done.
* Returns the current completion status of the task.
* Returns the type of the task.

* Subclasses must implement this method to provide their specific file format.

* Returns a human-readable string representation of the task,
* including its type icon, status icon, and description.
* Represents a list of tasks and provides methods to manipulate them.
* This class supports basic task operations such as adding, deleting,
* retrieving, and filtering tasks by date. It encapsulates an internal
* {@link List} to store tasks and ensures safe access via copies where appropriate.
/** The internal list that stores tasks. */
* Constructs a TaskList with the provided list of tasks.

* Adds a task to the list.

public Task delete(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Retrieves the task at the specified index.

* @return the task at the specified index
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the index is out of range
public Task get(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Returns the number of tasks in the list.
* @return the size of the task list
* Returns a copy of all tasks in the list.
* Returns a list of tasks that occur on the specified date.

*
  • Deadlines with a due date equal to the specified date

*
  • Events whose duration includes the specified date
* @param date the date to filter tasks by
* @return a list of tasks occurring on the given date
* Represents the type of a task.
* Each task type has a corresponding icon that can be used
* for display or file storage purposes.
/** A task with a specific deadline. */
/** An event with a start and end date/time. */
/** The icon associated with the task type. */
* Constructs a TaskType with the given icon.
* @param icon the string representation of the task type
* Returns the icon representing the task type.
* @return the task type icon as a string
* Represents a simple "to-do" task without a specific deadline or event duration.
* A Todo can be marked as done or not done.
* Constructs a Todo with the given description.
